meanings.definition: Having a physical or mental disability that limits movement, senses, or activities.
meanings.sent1: The handicapped boy used a wheelchair to move around the school.
meanings.sent2: The handicapped parking spot was reserved for those with disabilities.
meanings.sent3: The handicapped puppy struggled to keep up with the other dogs during playtime.
meanings.sent4: Her broken leg was a handicapped in the race to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The dark room handicapped his ability to see clearly.

meanings.definition: A disadvantage or obstacle that hinders progress or success.
meanings.sent1: Lack of experience can be a handicapped when applying for a job.
meanings.sent2: Financial difficulties can act as a handicapped to achieving one's goals.
meanings.sent3: His fear of heights was a handicapped during the team-building exercise.
meanings.sent4: The language barrier proved to be a handicapped in their communication.
meanings.sent5: Time management skills can help overcome the handicapped of procrastination.
